title: The Eisenhower matrix: understanding task management

options.label: C

multiple-choice.question: Who created the Eisenhower Matrix?

options.label: A
options.text: To sort out tasks that are less urgent and less important

options.label: B
options.text: To prioritize tasks that are important and need to be done today or tomorrow

options.label: C
options.text: To delegate tasks that are less important to others

options.label: D
options.text: To eliminate tasks that are not important at all

options.label: B
options.text: A review of an important document for your manager

options.label: C
options.text: A delegated task to a colleague

options.label: D
options.text: A task that is not important at all

options.label: A
options.text: To prioritize tasks that are important and need to be done today or tomorrow

options.label: B
options.text: To delegate tasks that are less important to others

options.label: C
options.text: To sort out tasks that are less urgent and less important

options.label: D
options.text: To eliminate tasks that are important but less urgent

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Meeting with a colleague to discuss a task

options.label: D
options.text: Eliminating a task that is not important at all

options.label: A
options.text: A task that is important and needs to be done today or tomorrow

options.label: B
options.text: A task that is important but less urgent

options.label: C
options.text: A task that is less important and less urgent

options.label: D
options.text: A task that is not important at all
